bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition identical with sha bing 沙病 , sand disease. Shi yi de xiao fang 世醫得效方 2: 艾湯，試沙證。 江南舊無，今所在有之。原其證古方不載，所感如傷寒，頭痛嘔噁，渾 身壯熱，手足指末微厥，或腹痛煩亂，須臾能殺人。先濃煎艾湯試之， 如吐即是。右用五月蠶蛻紙碎剪，安碗中，以盤蓋之，以百沸湯泡艾碗 許，仍以別紙封裹縫良久，乘熱飲之，就臥，以厚被蓋之，汗出愈 , …又 名水傷寒 , “Decoction with ai to test a sand condition. In former times [this condition] did not exist in the Jiangnan region. Nowadays it is present there everywhere. This condition was not listed in ancient recipes. It feels like harm caused by cold, with headache and vomiting and nausea. The entire body is very hot. The ends of the fingers and toes experience slight recession. In some cases there is abdominal pain, with vexation and confusion. After a short time it will kill the [afflicted] person. First one prepares a thick decoction of ai [and has the patient ingest it] as a test [whether he has a sand condition]. If he vomits, this is it. [For the indications listed] above one cuts paper prepared from silkwom sloths of the 5th month and places it into a bowl. This is to be covered with a plate. Then soak the ai bowl a little while in boiling hot water, and close the seams with additional paper for a long time. Have [the patient] avail himself of the heat and drink this. Then he is to lie down and to be covered with a thick quilt. When he sweats, he is cured…Another name is ‘ water-borne harm caused by cold ’”.
